Question
========
Which statements about conditional probability are correct? Select all that apply.

Answerlist
----------
* It can be larger or smaller than the marginal probability
* It always increases probability
* It uses information after the word 'given'
* If independent, P(A | B) = P(A)

Solution
========
Conditioning can increase or decrease probability depending on association. Independence means that conditioning does not change probabilities.
